extendedIngredients.name: fresh dill
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup minced fresh dill (from about 3 bunches)

extendedIngredients.name: red belgian endive
extendedIngredients.original: 4 heads of Belgian endive (green and red, if available)
extendedIngredients.originalName: Belgian endive (green and red, if available)

extendedIngredients.name: trout fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 8 ozs smoked trout fillets, broken into 1-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: smoked trout fillets, broken into 1-inch pieces

title: Endive With Smoked Trout And Herbed Cream Cheese
summary: Endive With Smoked Trout And Herbed Cream Cheese might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. This recipe makes 34 servings with 34 calories, 2g of protein, and 3g of fat each. For 32 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 6 hours and 4 minutes. If you have trout fillets, dill sprigs, lemon peel, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, pescatarian, and ketogenic diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 24%. This score is rather bad. Try Endive with Smoked Trout and Herbed Cream Cheese, Endive with Herbed Cream Cheese and Caramelized Apples, and Endive Spears with Smoked Trout for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                        Mix first 4 ingredients in small bowl. Season with freshly ground black pepper. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Cover; chill. Bring to room temperature before using.)                                                                            Separate endive into leaves. Spread small amount of cheese mixture on base end of each leaf. Top with trout piece; garnish with small dill sprig. Arrange filled leaves on platter. (Can be made 6 hours ahead. Cover; chill.)

steps.step: Mix first 4 ingredients in small bowl. Season with freshly ground black pepper. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Cover; chill. Bring to room temperature before using.)
Spread small amount of cheese mixture on base end of each leaf. Top with trout piece; garnish with small dill sprig. Arrange filled leaves on platter. (Can be made 6 hours ahead. Cover; chill.)
